li.title: nilpotent matrix
li.p: a square matrix powers of which are eventually the zero matrix

li.title: degree of nilpotency
li.p: the lowest positive exponent that takes a nilpotent matrix to zero; the positive number k for nilpotent N so that N^k = 0 but N^{k-1} \neq 0

li.title: companion matrix (of a monic polynomial)
li.p:
the n \times n matrix
\begin{bmatrix} 0 \amp 0 \amp 0 \amp \cdots \amp 0 \amp -a_0 \\ 1 \amp 0 \amp 0 \amp \cdots \amp 0 \amp -a_1 \\ 0 \amp 1 \amp 0 \amp \cdots \amp 0 \amp -a_2 \\ \vdots \amp \vdots \amp \vdots \amp \amp \vdots \amp \vdots \\ 0 \amp 0 \amp 0 \amp \cdots \amp 1 \amp -a_{n-1} \end{bmatrix} , where n is the degree and a_0,a_1,\dotsc,a_{n-1} the coefficients of the polynomial (with coefficient a_j corresponding to power x^j)
